answers.answer: Hello,Polyuria or urinating more than normal can be due to polydipsia or excessive fluid intake, which can be psychogenic, glucosuria in diabetes mellitus, Vasopressin or ADH deficiency as in central diabetes insipidus due to hypothalamic or pituitary disorders, resistance to ADH action at the site of renal tubules as in nephrogenic diabetes insipidus, chronic renal failure with concentration defect or structural malformations of kidney like obstructive uropathy, hydronephrosis.You need to get it evaluated and investigated from his paediatrician.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: A few days ago my 4-yr-old son began feeling a sense of urgency to pee again after just having peed.  It happens a few times a day, and overnight.  He'll go potty, then he goes right back within a few minutes, then back again a few minutes after that.  When he goes back, he says nothing else comes out... but he still feels like something needs to come out.  He also says that his underpants feel wet and cold like he wet them, but when we feel them they are totally dry.  What might give him that cold sensation?  He is uncircumcised and recently we were given a steroid cream to apply to the opening of his foreskin because it was beginning to close so much that the opening was becoming very tiny.  Could the steroid cream cause the cold feeling (he has the feeling even when it's nowhere near the time we applied the cream)?  And could the frequent feeling of needing to pee be Voiding Dysfunction?  He definitely holds his pee for way too long during the day because he doesn't want to stop playing to do it, and we read that can cause some problems with the muscles and create Voiding Dysfunction.  My big fear is something like Diabetes... but he has lots of energy, his weight hasn't changed at all nor his appetite or thirst, and otherwise seems to feel great.  What can this be??
title: 4-yr-old with frequent need to urinate
